commands.name: az network vhub route-map create
commands.syntax:
az network vhub route-map create --name
                                 --resource-group
                                 --vhub-name
                                 [--inbound-connection]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--outbound-connections]
                                 [--rules]
examples: az network vhub route-map create -n route-map-name -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name

commands.name: az network vhub route-map delete
commands.syntax:
az network vhub route-map delete [--ids]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--subscription]
                                 [--vhub-name]
                                 [--yes]
examples: az network vhub route-map delete -n route-map-name -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name

commands.name: az network vhub route-map get-inbound-routes
commands.summary: Get the inbound routes configured for the Virtual Hub on a particular connection.
commands.syntax:
az network vhub route-map get-inbound-routes [--connection-type]
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--resource-uri]
                                             [--subscription]
                                             [--vhub-name]
examples: az network vhub route-map get-inbound-routes -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name --connection-type ExpressRouteConnection --resource-uri /subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/expressRouteGateways/exrGw1/expressRouteConnections/exrConn1

commands.name: az network vhub route-map get-outbound-routes
commands.summary: Get the outbound routes configured for the Virtual Hub on a particular connection.
commands.syntax:
az network vhub route-map get-outbound-routes [--connection-type]
                                              [--ids]
                                              [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                              [--resource-group]
                                              [--resource-uri]
                                              [--subscription]
                                              [--vhub-name]
examples: az network vhub route-map get-outbound-routes -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name --connection-type ExpressRouteConnection --resource-uri /subscriptions/subid/resourceGroups/rg1/providers/Microsoft.Network/expressRouteGateways/exrGw1/expressRouteConnections/exrConn1

commands.name: az network vhub route-map list
commands.summary: List routem maps by resource group.
examples: az network vhub route-map list -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name

commands.name: az network vhub route-map show
commands.summary: Show the details of a route map.
examples: az network vhub route-map show -n route-map-name -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name

commands.name: az network vhub route-map update
commands.syntax:
az network vhub route-map update [--add]
                                 [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--ids]
                                 [--inbound-connection]
                                 [--name]
                                 [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                 [--outbound-connections]
                                 [--remove]
                                 [--resource-group]
                                 [--rules]
                                 [--set]
                                 [--subscription]
                                 [--vhub-name]
examples: az network vhub route-map update -n route-map-name -g rg --vhub-name vhub-name --rules "[{name:rule1,matchCriteria:[{matchCondition:Contains,routePrefix:[10.0.0.0/8]}],actions:[{type:Add,parameters:[{asPath:[22334]}]}]}]"

commands.name: az network vhub route-map wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
